  <h2 style="font-size: 20px; color: #2171B5;font-weight: bold; margin-top: 20px; border-bottom: 1px solid #F0F0F0; padding-bottom: 5px;">The Youthful Gambit: Investigating the Gender Gap in Youth Chess Competitions (Honour Thesis)</h2>
  <ul style="font-size: 18px; color: #737373;">
    <li>This thesis investigates gender disparities in competitive chess among players under 21, using FIDE Elo ratings and World Bank data to examine underlying trends.</li>
    <li>It challenges the assumption that progressive generational attitudes alone can rectify gender imbalances, highlighting the influential role of societal and cultural forces, particularly in command economies.</li>
    <li>Through a two-stage fixed-effects analysis, the study identifies a persistent gender-equality paradox with stagnating participation rates from 2015 to 2023, especially in countries recognized for gender equality, suggesting broader socio-economic and cultural determinants must be addressed for achieving gender parity in chess.</li>
    <li>Supervised by <a href="https://ideas.repec.org/e/pdi151.html" target="_blank" style="color: #2171B5; text-decoration: underline;">Dr. Dilmagani</a>, contributing to the understanding of sex roles in chess expertise.</li>
  </ul>
